pr_title: Review semantic convention for Http Client spans

timeline.message: Review semantic convention for Http Client spans

timeline.author: trask
trask

timeline.bodyText: interesting, makes sense for a negotiated connection, where we don't know flavor ahead of time
timeline.author: trask
trask

replies.bodyText: I don't :) It is IDEA's doing, so I have to accept :(
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: Reformat code puts the annotation there? I haven't seen that before. I agree with @iNikem that for normal methods, annotation above looks a bit better mostly due to how annotations end up getting colored in IDE GitHub etc. @iNikem Is it not worth manually fixing these?
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText:
Not reformat but "implement missing method", I think.
I don't want to fix this manually every time IDEA generates code for me. I can do it here, but it will not be sustainable
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: ya, i like type annotations, but they are not common. i'm very surprised Intellij does the "right thing" 😉
replies.author: trask
